Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: Draw two separate areas on paper that might represent different habitats, such as two blobs or shapes.
Draw at least one recognizable plant or animal, although it may not be appropriately placed in a specific habitat.
CANNOT: Correctly identify and label two distinct habitats as one land and one water habitat (student may draw random shapes or not differentiate between the two).
Accurately label the plants and animals or show clear differences between them in each habitat (student may mix up plants and animals or label randomly).
Illustrate a variety of species within each habitat, as they might draw one type of plant or animal repeatedly or only one type per habitat (student might not understand the concept of variety).
Effectively compare or show differences between the two habitats in terms of the plant and animal life they support (student might draw the same elements in both habitats without distinction).
Observe and illustrate patterns in plants and animals within each habitat, such as grouping similar organisms (student may not notice or reflect such patterns).
